required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Length for Nasal Mid-turbinate and Nasopharyngeal Swabs
clinical_study.official_title: Optimal Insertion Length for Nasal Mid-turbinate and Nasopharyngeal Swabs for Respiratory Virus Infection Diagnostic Testing - a Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aim to explore the optimal swap insertion length for mid-turbinate and nasopharyngeal samples. Our clinical trial took place at a Covid-19 test center in Copenhagen. Participants consisted of voluntary citizens who were at the test center for a nasopharyngeal antigen quicktest. An endoscopic examination was performed simultaneous with the swap to measure the length from the vestibulum nasi to the posterior wall of the nasopharynx and the mid-turbinate.

primary_outcome.measure: Length from the vestibulum nasi to the posterior wall of the nasopharynx.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion at the testcenter until the COVID-19 testing was completed.
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopic measurement of the length from the vestibulum nasi to the posterior wall of the nasopharynx.

primary_outcome.measure: Length from the vestibulum nasi to the mid-turbinate.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From inclusion at the testcenter until the endoscopic examination was completed
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopic measurement of the length from the vestibulum nasi to the mid-turbinate.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Collecting of Clinical Specimens for COVID-19 Testing
arm_group.description: Nasopharyngeal swab is performed on all participants to collect specimens for Rapid antigen COVID-19 Testing

intervention.description: A nasopharyngeal swab was performed endoscopically video guided to measure the actual length from to the mid turbinate and the posterior nasopharyngeal wall
intervention.arm_group_label: Collecting of Clinical Specimens for COVID-19 Testing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referred for COVID-19 testing
Exclusion Criteria:
- Nose patology
